text: I find this game quite fascinating, a full RPG with a huge and awesome soundtrack featuring... Miis. It's probably one of those games I will someday decide to randomly play, it looks surprisingly solid. This boss theme is a head bopper, especially when the synth starts at 0:38.
author: SupraDarky

text: The music throughout Miitopia is really catchy. If you do decide to play it though, DO NOT obsess over 100%ing it as enticing as it might seem at first. This decision will eventually sap you of all desire to play.
author: AwesomeNick94

text: It's a lot like Tomodachi life where you watch it a lot more than you play it. So base your decisions off that.
author: Waxle

text: SupraDarky it's very worth a play.  I have it and only gotten to the second half, which it throws you a curve ball.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text:
SupraDarky 
I know right.
This soundtrack suprised me almost as much as how good the final fantasy echoes of time's boss theme was i mean that thing is a ds spin off but still has some neat tracks like "rakiex" which i actually advise to check out if you like celtic style tracks
author: the best boy

text: Have you tried the demo? If not, that might be a good start. It's quite lengthy, too.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing

text:
First time I saw that game I was just like “oh another Mii game..” then I downloaded the demo by curiosity and.. I loved it. It's pretty solid and very fun to say the least. Not perfect but I spent a lot of time on it.
I don't think Nintendo intends to make Miitopia 2 but if they do they' ll get the opportunity to make it even better.
More “exploration” moments like when you control your character in city, the possibility to choose the action of your teammates or even giving each teammates a little quest before recruiting them !
I dunno, I think there's a lot of possibilities to make that already fun game even better !
